title: cannot update Node debug
body:

node.body:
Macbook Pro- VsCode: 1.29.1
Ok, My problem ("Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly (exit code: 1)") arised after the latest vscode update. I lost the degugging feature. After a little googling I realized this is something related with Node Debug builtin extension. It was on the state of "reload to update".  But it didn't update. Nothing helped. then I cd into .vscode/extensions folder deleted all the extensions. And the problem solved in return I lost all my settings. :-)

then I cd into .vscode/extensions folder deleted all the extensions.

node.body:
@sandy081 Built-in extensions (e.g. ms-vscode.node-debug and ms-vscode.node-debug2)  are not updatable. They should have no UI for updating and uninstalling.

Builtin extensions should not appear in the `.vscode/extensions` folder. The only reason they could end-up there is that the user copied them there or installed a *.vsix containing them.
node.bodyText:
@sandy081 Built-in extensions (e.g. ms-vscode.node-debug and ms-vscode.node-debug2)  are not updatable. They should have no UI for updating and uninstalling.
Builtin extensions should not appear in the .vscode/extensions folder. The only reason they could end-up there is that the user copied them there or installed a *.vsix containing them.
node.bodyHTML:
@sandy081 Built-in extensions (e.g. ms-vscode.node-debug and ms-vscode.node-debug2) are not updatable. They should have no UI for updating and uninstalling.

Builtin extensions should not appear in the .vscode/extensions folder. The only reason they could end-up there is that the user copied them there or installed a *.vsix containing them.

bodyParsed.sent: @sandy081 Built-in extensions (e.g.
ms-vscode.node-debug and ms-vscode.node-debug2)  are not updatable.
They should have no UI for updating and uninstalling.
Builtin extensions should not appear in the .vscode/extensions folder.
The only reason they could end-up there is that the user copied them there or installed a *.vsix containing them.

node.body: Ok, I double checked in the code we neither show update buttons not auto update built in extensions. Not sure how user got into this. Also user says deleting `.vscode/extensions` folder fixed this, does that mean user has manually downloaded the node debug extension into that folder?

node.body:
I filed an issue quite a while ago because both Matt and I had the node or node2 extension in our .vscode/extensions folder, and neither of us knew how it got there.

It's possible that we did something to put it there for development at some point but I didn't think that was the case. It's possible that there's some weird 1/10^6 bug that can cause it to get installed there?
node.bodyText:
I filed an issue quite a while ago because both Matt and I had the node or node2 extension in our .vscode/extensions folder, and neither of us knew how it got there.
It's possible that we did something to put it there for development at some point but I didn't think that was the case. It's possible that there's some weird 1/10^6 bug that can cause it to get installed there?
node.bodyHTML:
I filed an issue quite a while ago because both Matt and I had the node or node2 extension in our .vscode/extensions folder, and neither of us knew how it got there.

It's possible that we did something to put it there for development at some point but I didn't think that was the case. It's possible that there's some weird 1/10^6 bug that can cause it to get installed there?

It's possible that there's some weird 1/10^6 bug that can cause it to get installed there?

node.body: for development we load the built-in extensions to `.build/builtInExtensions` inside the vscode project folder. So they should not end up in `~/.vscode/extensions`.
node.bodyText: for development we load the built-in extensions to .build/builtInExtensions inside the vscode project folder. So they should not end up in ~/.vscode/extensions.

So they should not end up in ~/.vscode/extensions.
